title: Great place for a weekend night
text:
We usually stay in mid-town since it's close to theaters, dining, shopping, etc. But this turned out to be a home run. The hotel is great, we had a corner room which was large, and had great views of the Hudson. It's a snap to get on the 1,2 or 3 train up to Times Square. Or you can always take a cab or a ride-share service. We had dinner at Morton's which is 1/2 block away. There is a mall across the street, Trinity Church, the Freedom Tower, etc. for sightseeing and if you walk over to the other side of Broadway there are more restaurants and night-life. To get a room this great for under $150 a night in NYC is amazing!
